messages.content: saw some discussion further up about the Pre-Alpha/Alpha, which makes me a little curious. Devs, what do you internally consider the distinction between Pre-Alpha and Alpha to be? I feel like often these state of the game terminologies mean different things for different development studios.

That, no doubt, you can get as many answers as there are people probably. The issue has more to do with words as *described* versus words as *prescribed*. Personally, all these terms are vague and nebulous to me, except for in relation to each other. On a scale of "this is all prototype" to "this is representative of the quality and polish where people feel comfortable not having to qualify everything as still-in-development", it's easy enough to say alpha - beta - release. But a lot of that is less meaningful in the world of online games that continue to be developed for years, even a decade or more.
